problem_text:
19.94. By definition two elements g1 and g2 of a free metabelian group F with basis {x1, . . . , xn} have the same distribution if the equations g1(x1, . . . , xn) = g and g2(x1, . . . , xn) = g have the same number of solutions in any finite metabelian group G for every g ∈G. Is it true that elements g1 and g2 have the same distribution if and only if they are conjugate by some automorphism of F?
E. I. Timoshenko
